titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Orson Kinnear affidavit 1977.482
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-11-30 21:22:29 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: A typed affidavit that serves as proof of the birth of Orson Kinnear in place of a birth certificate, and also verifies the identifies of Kinnear's parents and siblings.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Orson Kinnear (1864-1925) was born in Norfolk, St. Lawrence County, N.Y. to parents Kenneth and Celestia Kinnear and later resided in Durand, IL. He had two brothers, George Kinnear (d. 1950), who resided in Seattle, WA and was a steamboat engineer associated with the Alaska Steamship Company, and William H. Kinnear, who resided in Tenafly, N.J. and was a lawyer with offices in New York, N.Y.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Orson Kinnear affidavit, 1977.482, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A typed affidavit that serves as proof of the birth of Orson Kinnear in place of a birth certificate, and also verifies the identifies of Kinnear's parents and siblings. It is signed by a notary public in Durand, IL and dated December 14, 1940.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
